meanings.sent1: The pleonal decorations on the cake made it look too fancy for a simple party.
meanings.sent2: She always wore pleonal jewelry, even to the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The pleonal amount of toppings on the pizza caused it to collapse under its own weight.
meanings.sent4: His pleonal enthusiasm for the project was infectious, motivating the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The pleonal amount of homework assigned by the teacher was overwhelming for the students.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excess or surplus
meanings.sent1: The pleonal supply of snacks in the pantry lasted for months.
meanings.sent2: The pleonal rainfall caused flooding in the streets.
meanings.sent3: His pleonal collection of comic books filled an entire room in his house.
meanings.sent4: The pleonal number of stars in the sky on a clear night was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The pleonal amount of laughter coming from the comedy show could be heard from outside the theater.

meanings.definition: Containing more than is needed or usual
meanings.sent1: The pleonal amount of sugar in the drink made it too sweet for her liking.
meanings.sent2: The pleonal layers of clothing kept him warm in the cold winter weather.
meanings.sent3: The pleonal number of chairs in the room made it feel crowded.
meanings.sent4: Her pleonal kindness towards strangers was heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The pleonal speed of the car made her nervous on the winding road.
